body.title: Reading XML structure diagrams
body.p: A box with a label, as shown in the first diagram in the figure How to read a structure diagram, represents an XML element. The description inside the box, if any, indicates what the element may contain. A group of elements that work together is represented by a three-dimensional block, as shown in the second diagram in the figure. Follow links a diagram's description to find a detailed description of a group.
A number range indicates the number of occurances an element or a group may appear. If no number range is shown, the number of occurances (the multiplicity) is one.

fig.title: How to read a structure diagram

section.title: Example
section.p: In the figure "Diagram showing structure of a topic head element," the identify, history, and index group of elements should appear once in the order shown inside a head element. The figures "Identity group," "History group," and "Index group" then provide the detailed structure for each group.
